instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Battery dead
threads.message:
Hello, I have recently fixed mac that has been broken for over a year. Now I have a problem with the battery. It's stuck at 1% and mac will not work without being connected to charger. 

Question: Do I check if there is anything else or is the battery dead and I just need to replace it ?

threads.title: Battery dead
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ( <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> )

threads.title: Battery dead
threads.message:
macOS doesn't say anything about battery replace?
Check its state in System Report.

threads.title: Battery dead
threads.message: yes, it says it should be replaced I was just wondering if that's the case or should I try something else.
